title: Rule by law in Russia, Sharia law in Nigeria

content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the judiciary in Russia and Nigeria?

choices.label: Russian Supreme Court justices serve 4-year terms, and Nigerian Supreme Court justices serve 12-year terms.
Russian courts have the power of judicial review, but Nigerian courts do not.
Russian Supreme Court justices are approved by the president, and Nigerian Supreme Court justices are elected.
Russia’s government uses the judicial system to target opposition, and Islamic Sharia Courts have been established in northern Nigeria.

content.answer: Russia’s government uses the judicial system to target opposition, and Islamic Sharia Courts have been established in northern Nigeria.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
